definition: A small body of matter from outer space that enters Earth's atmosphere, becoming incandescent as a result of friction.
A meteor that survives its passage through the earth's atmosphere such that part of it strikes the ground.
A smooth, glass-like surface that forms on meteorites as their exteriors melt during atmospheric entry.
Here, it refers to the binding material in which smaller objects are embedded within a meteorite.
The cloud of gas and dust from which the solar system was formed.
A type of stony meteorite containing small mineral grains called chondrules.
Greek for "seed", used metaphorically to describe the appearance of chondrules in chondrites.
Small, round particles in meteorites, formed from once-molten droplets of silicate.
Minerals composed of silicon and oxygen, often with additional metals.
Components of a meteorite that are resistant to heat and melting, containing high concentrations of certain minerals.
Changed from a gas to a solid or liquid state; here it refers to the process by which minerals form from the solar nebula.
The predicted order in which minerals would solidify from a cooling gas, based on their chemical properties.
A compound of iron and sulfur, often found in meteoritic material.
Related to a nebula, which in this context is the cloud of material from which the solar system formed.
Dust that originates outside our solar system but is found within it, often in nebulae.
Meteorites that contain chondrules and have a composition similar to that of the sun, except for volatile elements.
Comparisons of the amounts of different elements, used to study the composition of celestial objects.
Chemical elements that can easily vaporize or form gases at relatively low temperatures.
Metaphorically describes chondrites as being like a refined version of the sun, having lost only the most volatile components.
Another metaphor suggesting that chondrites are like the sun's residue after gases have been removed.
The substance that makes up a nebula; in this context, it relates to the material from which the solar system was formed.
